result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles G. Py

records.addlTxt:
11:22 AM Defendant Charles G. Py appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney J. Eric Olson in court for Charles G. Py.  Attorney Sydney Elizabeth Star in court for State of Wisconsin. Clerk HM.  No objection to DE's appearance by zoom today.  State is compliant with victim rights notification.  $135 prosecution costs. DE enters guilty plea. Court finds DE guilty. PSI ordered.  SEH scheduled. Bond revoked.  
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Assistant District Attorney Sydney Star appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared by zoom w/ Attorney Olson.    Clerk HMcBride.  Atty Olson requests adjmt to perform research on prior convictions.  FPT 10/19 11am. Bond continued.   TRs trail.

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.   Defendant in custody and appeared by zoom w/ Attorney Olson.   Clerk HMcBride. Atty Olson has now received the abstract from IL. Adjmt granted.  FPT 9/7 9am.  Bond continued.   TRs trail.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared by zoom w/ Attorney Olson.    Clerk HMcBride.  Atty Olson not able to meet with DE by video to discuss case - tech probs with video.  Atty Olson also needs discovery.  Adjmt granted.  FPT 7/21 10am. Bond continued.   TRs trail.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State. Attorney J. Eric Olson in court with Defendant Charles G. Py who appears in custody.  Clerk: PT  
 DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over to Br 1.   Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

134PM  Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Eric Olson.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on March 10, 2022 at 09:45 am.  Bond continued w/same conditions.  sg
Assessment of Costs for Expert Laboratory Analysis and Witness Fees - $70.00
Assessment of Costs for Blood Draws / Prosecution Costs - $65.00

Defendant Charles G. Py in court, in custody.  Attorney Carli A. McNeill appeared for the Prosecution.    Clerk JT  Minutes:  SPD has been unable to appoint an attorney for DE for today's hearing. Court holds colloquy with DE re: proceeding pro se or waiving time to allow SPD to appoint an attorney.  DE waives time for preliminary hearing. Court reschedules preliminary hearing to an attorney status hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for March 3, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *Not to drive w/o VALID Driver's License.  If released, Report to WCS by 11:00 the next business day; Submit to random UA's upon request.  Comply w/ all program requirements & provide all required information.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with:  Kevin K

02:04 PM Attorney Jazmin Ramirez Bailon appeared for the State. Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Seth Johnson. Clerk JT  Minutes:   Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; Preliminary hearing set for January 28, 2022 at 10:15 a.m. $15000 Cash Bond Set w/ same conditions (see bond entry). Attorney moves to amend complaint to OWI 1st due to lack of probable cause - Court denies motion. mi
